intro: Sphaeradenia killipii, commonly known as the Killip's sphaeradenia, is a rare tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence known as a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are typically dark green in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
